itical needs: Providing financial

of critical need, such as natural disasters  
or significant, unplanned expenses.Local Needs Grants. The Alexion Charitable 
Foundation focuses most of its resources  
on Rare BelongingTM funding priorities.  
However, a portion of its funding goes  
to organizations in the communities where Alexion has a major presence, but without the strict requirement of benefiting the rare disease community. 
Local Needs funding focuses on helping people 
who are disadvantaged or disenfranchised. This enables the Foundation to positively impact the communities where we live and work. Examples of initiatives that might be supported include:
•
 A
dvancing emotional well-being through 
mental health and other social services. 
•
 A
dvancing educational opportunities 
through basic education, science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) education, job readiness and other skills.
•
 A
dvancing the cause of diversity and 
inclusion in society and critical institutions.Corporate Giving. The guidelines for Alexion’s Corporate Giving program are similar in focus to the Local Needs Grants of the Alexion Charitable Foundation. Alexion’s Corporate Giving mission is to positively impact our local communities — with a particular focus on people who are disadvantaged or disenfranchised — through initiatives that advance emotional well-being, provide educational opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion in society and critical institutions. 
As a company, Alexion’s positive impact 
reaches beyond just the dollars we contribute. We also aim to positively affect people affected by a rare disease through initiatives such as  
our Diagnostics Strategy (Page 42), Research  
and Medical Education (Page 45), Patient Organization Support (Page 28) and  
Patient Support Programs (Page 27). 
Rare BelongingTM unifies a suite of funding priorities  
to benefit people affected by a rare disease – including 
patients, their families and caregivers.
